page.title: 06DITCHFORD LAKES
page.content:
DITCHFORD LAKES.
Ditchford Lakes were formed by old gravel workings in the late 1930's.They are now mainly used by private anglers who are after the stocks of tench,carp,roach,bream,pike, rudd and eels.These lakes are owned by East Northants District Council but are fished by Rushden,Higham and Irchester Angling Associations and the Wellingborough Nene Angling Club. The lakes cover about half a square mile and also supply some of Rushden's water,which is purified at a treatment plant owned by the Anglian Water Authority.The lakes are very shallow,with an average depth of five feet.The banks are mainly uncut grass and bullrushes,ant there is a good selection of wildlife,including swans,herons and moorhens. P.Williams
